Config:  Stable 20020214, Sun JDK 1.3.1, Solaris 8.

I fired up a clean install of Stable 20020214 and started fooling around with
the preferences settings, particularly the Netscape path in the Help settings.

Something that I did (I'm not sure what, sorry) led to a NullPointerException.
I eventually got Eclipse shut down.

Now, whenever I start it, it comes up with a very persistent "Internal Error"
pop-up for a NullPointerException.  I can click on "Details>>" to expand it
and see the stack trace, but I can't do anything else with it -- in particular
I can't dismiss it, neither by clicking the OK button nor by selecting Close 
in the CDE/Motif window frame.  This probably isn't too surprising, because
pretty much any window activity (e.g. mouse-enter and mouse-exit on the pop-up
window) generates another instance of the same NPE.

If I ignore the pop-up, and do a File->Exit (or a Motif Close) on the main
Eclipse window, then the main window goes away but the pop-up hangs around
(and the Java process has not exited).  If I then try to dismiss the pop-up,
(again, using either the OK button or Motif Close), sometimes it stubbornly
stays, and sometimes it generates a segfault in SWT native code.

(I didn't realize until fairly late in the game that there may actually have
been multiple pop-windows stacked exactly on top of each other, so the 
"I can't dismiss it" stuff above might be a lie).

As an exercise in voodoo I tried deleting the .metadata/.registry file and
then starting Eclipse, but that didn't change anything.

If it's useful to anyone, I have kept a copy of the broken workspace metadata.

Below I have included a stack trace of the NPE (from .log) and a Sun JDK
logs of the SWT segfault.
